metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4001 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A race condition was found in the Linux kernel's ebpf verifier betweenbpf_map_update_elem and bpf_map_freeze due to a missing lock inkernel/bpf/syscall.c. In this flaw, a local user with a special privilege(cap_sys_admin or cap_bpf) can modify the frozen mapped address space. Thisflaw affects kernel versions prior to 5.16 rc2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10

No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1003-starfive - 5.19.0-1003.4
No subscription required
